ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Time Point
During the past 6 months, how many family members and friends would you say have been very important to you?
Notes: Number of People; Total support number

ElementDescription: How many of these people do you have daily contact with?
Notes: Number of People; Total daily support number - should not be greater than prior question/total support number

ElementDescription: How many of the people who are very important to you are: heavy alcohol and drug user(s)
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total support number

ElementDescription: How many heavy alcohol and drug user(s) do you see daily?
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total daily support number or prior number of people who are both heavy alcohol AND drug users in support system

ElementDescription: How many of the people who are very important to you are : heavy alcohol users:
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total support number

ElementDescription: How many heavy alcohol users do you see daily?
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total daily support number or number of heavy alcohol users in support system

ElementDescription: How many of the people who are very important to you are: heavy drug users:
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total daily support number

ElementDescription: How many heavy drug users do you see daily?
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total daily support number or number of heavy drug users in support system

ElementDescription: How many of the people who are very important to you : abstain from/do not use alcohol and drugs?
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total daily support number

ElementDescription: How many that abstain from or do not use alcohol and drugs do you see daily?
Notes: Number of People; should not be greater than total daily support number or number of people who abstain/do not use in support system

ElementDescription: IPI Total Network Size
Average Network Support for Abstinence
Notes: Mean of rnodrk1 for all people listed

ElementDescription: Number of Daily Contact Network Members
Total Network Contacts over Past 6 Months
Notes: Among contact_1 for all people listed: (# daily contacts)*182 + (# 3-6 times per week contacts)*117+ (# 1-2 times per week contacts)*39+ (# every other week contacts)*13+ (# once per month contacts)*6+ (# less than monthly contacts)*3+ (# once in past 6mn contacts)

ElementDescription: Average Daily Network Contacts (past 6 months)
Average Contacts over Network Size (6 months)
Average Importance Rating over Network
Notes: Mean of imp_1 for all people listed

ElementDescription: Average General Support Rating over Network
Notes: Mean of supp1 for all people listed

ElementDescription: Number of Heavy Drinkers in Network
Percent Network Heavy Drinkers
Any Heavy Drinkers in Network
Number of Abstainers/Recovering Alcoholics in Network
Notes: Total reports of abstainers or recovering (drstat1 =1 or =2)

ElementDescription: Percent Network Abstainers/ Recovering Alcoholics
No Abstainers/Recovering Alcoholics in Network
Notes: 0 = Drinkers; 1 = No Abstainers/Recovering Alcoholics; =1 when NABREC = 0

ElementDescription: Number of Drinkers in Network
Notes: Total reports of light/moderate/heavy drinkers (drstat1 =3 or =4 or =5)

ElementDescription: Percent Network Drinkers
Any Drinkers in Network
Number of Moderate/Heavy Drinkers in Network
Notes: Total reports of moderate or heavy drinkers (drstat1 =4 or =5)

ElementDescription: Percent Network Moderate/Heavy Drinkers
Relationship of person to subject
Notes: 1=Partner; 2= Ex-partner; 3= Boy/girlfriend ; 4= Child, age 12+; 5=Parent; 6=Sibling; 7=Other relative; 8=Friend; 9=Co-worker; 10=AA member; 11=Child, age 0-11; 12=Grandchild, age 12+; 13=Grandchild, age 0-11; 14=Study therapist; 20= Other

ElementDescription: During the past 6 months on average how frequently have you been in contact with...?
Notes: 1=Once in past 6 months; 2=Less than monthly; 3= About once a month; 4=Every other week; 5=Once or twice a week; 6=Three to six times a week; 7=Daily (7 times a week)

ElementDescription: How important has this person been to you?
Notes: 1=Not at all Important; 2=Not very Important; 3=Somewhat Important; 4=Important; 5=Very Important; 6=Extremely Important

ElementDescription: To what extent is this person generally supportive of you...
Notes: 1=Not at all Supportive; 2=Not very Supportive; 3=Somewhat Supportive; 4= Supportive; 5=Very Supportive; 6=Extremely Supportive

ElementDescription: What is this person''s drinking status?
Notes: 1 = Recovering alcoholic; 2 = Abstainer; 3 = Light drinker; 4 = Moderate drinker; 5 = Heavy drinker

ElementDescription: How often does this person drink alcohol?
Notes: 0 = Not in past six months; 1 = Once in past six months; 2 = Less often than monthly; 3 = About once a month; 4 = About every other week; 5 = One or two times a week; 6 = Three to six times a week; 7 = Daily

ElementDescription: How has or would this person react to your drinking?
Notes: 1 = Left, or made you leave when you''re drinking; 2 = Didn''t Accept; 3 = Neutral; 4 = Accepted; 5 = Encouraged
